1{-# LANGUAGE ScopedTypeVariables #-}
2{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
3
4-- | Content operators on texts.
5
6module Koshucode.Baala.Cop.Text
7  ( copsText,
8    copSuffix, copUnsuffix,
9  ) where
10
11import qualified Data.Char                       as Ch
12import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Overture        as O
13import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base            as B
14import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax          as S
15import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Data            as D
16import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Cop.Message     as Msg
17
18-- | Content operators on texts.
19copsText :: (D.CContent c) => [D.Cop c]
20copsText =
21    [ D.CopCalc  (D.copInfix "*=")                copEndWithInfix
22    , D.CopCalc  (D.copInfix "*=*")               copContainInfix
23    , D.CopCalc  (D.copInfix "=*")                copBeginWithInfix
24
25    , D.CopCalc  (D.copNormal "base-part")        copBasePart
26    , D.CopCalc  (D.copNormal "char")             copChar
27    , D.CopCalc  (D.copNormal "char-group")       copCharGroup
28    , D.CopCalc  (D.copNormal "check")            copCheck
29    , D.CopCalc  (D.copNormal "from-bool")        copFromBool
30    , D.CopCalc  (D.copNormal "char-group-1")     copCharGroup1
31    , D.CopCalc  (D.copNormal "code-list")        copCodeList
32    , D.CopCalc  (D.copNormal "dir-part")         copDirPart
33    , D.CopCalc  (D.copNormal "general-symbol?")  copGeneralSymbol
34    , D.CopCalc  (D.copNormal "numeric-symbol?")  copNumericSymbol
35    , D.CopCalc  (D.copNormal "plain-symbol?")    copPlainSymbol
36    , D.CopCalc  (D.copNormal "short-symbol?")    copShortSymbol
37
38    , D.CopCalc  (D.copNormal "trim-begin")       copTrimBegin
39    , D.CopCalc  (D.copNormal "trim-end")         copTrimEnd
40    , D.CopCalc  (D.copNormal "trim-both")        copTrimBoth
41    , D.CopCalc  (D.copNormal "trim-text-begin")  copTrimTextBegin
42    , D.CopCalc  (D.copNormal "trim-text-end")    copTrimTextEnd
43    , D.CopCalc  (D.copNormal "trim-text-both")   copTrimTextBoth
44
45    , D.CopCalc  (D.copNormal "divide-text-begin") $ copDivideTextBy divideBegin
46    , D.CopCalc  (D.copNormal "divide-text-first") $ copDivideTextBy divideFirst
47    , D.CopCalc  (D.copNormal "divide-text-last")  $ copDivideTextBy divideLast
48    , D.CopCalc  (D.copNormal "divide-text-end")   $ copDivideTextBy divideEnd
49    , D.CopCalc  (D.copNormal "divide-text-all")   $ copDivideTextBy divideAll
50
51    , D.CopCalc  (D.copNormal "unwords")          copUnwords
52    , D.CopCalc  (D.copNormal "unwords-by")       copUnwordsBy
53    , D.CopCalc  (D.copNormal "words")            copWords
54    , D.CopCalc  (D.copNormal "words-by")         copWordsBy
55
56    , D.CopCalc  (D.copNormal "suffix")           copSuffix
57    , D.CopCalc  (D.copNormal "unsuffix")         copUnsuffix
58
59    , D.CopCalc  (D.copNormal "match-beg")        copBeginWithNormal
60    , D.CopCalc  (D.copNormal "match-end")        copEndWithNormal
61    , D.CopCalc  (D.copNormal "match-mid")        copContainNormal
62    ]
63
64typeUnmatch :: D.CTypeOf c => [B.Ab c] -> B.Ab c
65typeUnmatch _ = Msg.unmatchType ""
66
67
68-- ----------------------  begin-with / end-with
69
70copBeginWithNormal, copEndWithNormal, copContainNormal :: (D.CContent c) => D.CopCalc c
71copBeginWithNormal  = copMatchNormal B.isPrefixOf B.isPrefixOf
72copEndWithNormal    = copMatchNormal B.isSuffixOf B.isSuffixOf
73copContainNormal    = copMatchNormal B.isInfixOf  B.isInfixOf
74
75copBeginWithInfix, copEndWithInfix, copContainInfix :: (D.CContent c) => D.CopCalc c
76copBeginWithInfix  = copMatchInfix B.isPrefixOf B.isPrefixOf
77copEndWithInfix    = copMatchInfix B.isSuffixOf B.isSuffixOf
78copContainInfix    = copMatchInfix B.isInfixOf  B.isInfixOf
79
80copMatchNormal :: (D.CContent c) => (String -> String -> Bool) -> ([c] -> [c] -> Bool) -> D.CopCalc c
81copMatchNormal bf1 bf2 arg =
82    do (part, whole) <- D.getRightArg2 arg
83       copMatch bf1 bf2 (part, whole)
84
85copMatchInfix :: (D.CContent c) => (String -> String -> Bool) -> ([c] -> [c] -> Bool) -> D.CopCalc c
86copMatchInfix bf1 bf2 arg =
87    do (whole, part) <- D.getRightArg2 arg
88       copMatch bf1 bf2 (part, whole)
89
90copMatch :: (D.CContent c)
91  => (String -> String -> Bool) -> ([c] -> [c] -> Bool) -> (c, c) -> B.Ab c
92copMatch bf1 bf2 (part, whole)
93    | isText2 part whole = match bf1 D.gText
94    | isList2 part whole = match bf2 D.gList
95    | otherwise          = D.putFalse
96    where match bf g = D.putBool $ bf (g part) (g whole)
97
98isList2 :: (D.CList c) => c -> c -> Bool
99isList2 x y = D.isList x && D.isList y
100
101isText2 :: (D.CText c) => c -> c -> Bool
102isText2 x y = D.isText x && D.isText y
103
104
105-- ----------------------  text
106
107-- char 70 => "F"
108copChar :: (D.CContent c) => D.CopCalc c
109copChar = op where
110    op [Right c] | D.isDec c = D.putText [Ch.chr $ fromInteger $ D.decimalNum $ D.gDec c]
111    op xs = typeUnmatch xs
112
113-- code-list "abc" => [ 97 : 98 : 99 ]
114copCodeList :: (D.CContent c) => D.CopCalc c
115copCodeList = op where
116    op [Right t] | D.isText t = Right $ D.contentMapTextList contOrd t
117    op xs = typeUnmatch xs
118
119    contOrd :: (D.CDec c) => Char -> c
120    contOrd = D.pInt . Ch.ord
121
122-- char-group "a!" => [ 'letter : 'punct ]
123copCharGroup :: (D.CContent c) => D.CopCalc c
124copCharGroup = op where
125    op [Right t] | D.isText t = Right $ D.contentMapTextList contGroup t
126    op xs = typeUnmatch xs
127
128    contGroup :: (D.CText c) => Char -> c
129    contGroup = D.pText . charGroup
130
131-- char-group-1 "a!" => 'letter
132copCharGroup1 :: (D.CContent c) => D.CopCalc c
133copCharGroup1 = op where
134    op [Right t] | D.isText t = case D.gText t of
135                                  (c : _) -> D.putText $ charGroup c
136                                  _       -> Right D.empty
137    op xs = typeUnmatch xs
138
139charGroup :: Char -> String
140charGroup = O.generalCategoryName . O.majorGeneralCategory
141
142
143-- ----------------------  from-bool
144
145-- from-bool "yes" "no" (+) => "yes"
146copFromBool :: (D.CContent c) => D.CopCalc c
147copFromBool = op where
148    op [Right t, Right f, Right c]
149        | D.isBool c = Right $ fromBool t f $ D.gBool c
150        | otherwise  = Right c
151    op xs = typeUnmatch xs
152
153-- check (+) => "✓" (U+2713)
154copCheck :: (D.CContent c) => D.CopCalc c
155copCheck = op where
156    op [Right c]
157        | D.isBool c = Right $ from D.empty $ D.gBool c
158        | otherwise  = Right c
159    op [Right c, Right alt]
160        | D.isBool c = Right $ from alt $ D.gBool c
161        | otherwise  = Right c
162    op xs = typeUnmatch xs
163
164    from = fromBool (D.pText "✓")
165
166-- | Choose true/false sign for Boolean value.
167fromBool :: (D.CContent c) => c -> c -> Bool -> c
168fromBool t _ True   = t
169fromBool _ f False  = f
170
171
172-- ----------------------  base-part / dir-part
173
174-- dir-part "/" "aa/bb/cc.k" => "aa/bb"
175copDirPart :: (D.CContent c) => D.CopCalc c
176copDirPart = copDirBasePart fst
177
178-- base-part "/" "aa/bb/cc.k" => "aa/bb"
179copBasePart :: (D.CContent c) => D.CopCalc c
180copBasePart = copDirBasePart snd
181
182copDirBasePart :: (D.CContent c) => ((String, String) -> String) -> D.CopCalc c
183copDirBasePart part = op where
184    op [Right sep, Right t]
185        | D.isText sep && D.isText t =
186            Right $ D.contentApText (part . dirBasePart (head $ D.gText sep)) t
187    op xs = typeUnmatch xs
188
189dirBasePart :: Char -> String -> (String, String)
190dirBasePart sep s =
191    case reverse $ B.divide sep s of
192      (base : dir) -> (B.intercalate [sep] $ reverse dir, base)
193      []           -> ("", "")
194
195
196-- ----------------------  words words-by
197
198copWords :: (D.CContent c) => D.CopCalc c
199copWords arg =
200    do ws <- D.getRightArg1 arg
201       if D.isText ws
202          then D.putList $ map D.pText $ words $ D.gText ws
203          else typeUnmatch arg
204
205copWordsBy :: (D.CContent c) => D.CopCalc c
206copWordsBy arg =
207    do (sep, ws) <- D.getRightArg2 arg
208       case D.isText ws && D.isText sep of
209         False -> typeUnmatch arg
210         True  -> let isSep = (`elem` D.gText sep)
211                  in D.putList $ map D.pText $ B.wordsBy isSep $ D.gText ws
212
213
214-- ----------------------  unwords unwords-by
215
216copUnwords :: forall c. (D.CContent c) => D.CopCalc c
217copUnwords arg =
218    do x <- D.getRightArg1 arg
219       D.putText $ unwords $ wordList x
220
221copUnwordsBy :: forall c. (D.CContent c) => D.CopCalc c
222copUnwordsBy arg =
223    do (sep, x) <- D.getRightArg2 arg
224       case D.isText sep of
225         True  -> let sep' = D.gText sep
226                  in D.putText $ B.intercalate sep' $ wordList x
227         False -> typeUnmatch arg
228
229wordList :: (D.CContent c) => c -> [String]
230wordList c
231    | D.isList c  = concatMap wordList $ D.gList c
232    | D.isText c  = [D.gText c]
233    | D.isDec c   = [D.encodeDecimal $ D.gDec c]
234    | otherwise   = []
235
236
237-- ----------------------  trim
238
239copTrimBegin :: (D.CContent c) => D.CopCalc c
240copTrimBegin = copTrimBy O.trimBegin
241
242copTrimEnd :: (D.CContent c) => D.CopCalc c
243copTrimEnd = copTrimBy O.trimEnd
244
245copTrimBoth :: (D.CContent c) => D.CopCalc c
246copTrimBoth = copTrimBy O.trimBoth
247
248copTrimBy :: (D.CContent c) => O.StringMap -> D.CopCalc c
249copTrimBy f arg =
250    do text <- D.getRightArg1 arg
251       case D.isText text of
252         True  -> D.putText $ f (D.gText text)
253         False -> typeUnmatch arg
254
255copTrimTextBegin :: (D.CContent c) => D.CopCalc c
256copTrimTextBegin = copTrimTextBy trimTextBegin
257
258copTrimTextEnd :: (D.CContent c) => D.CopCalc c
259copTrimTextEnd = copTrimTextBy trimTextEnd
260
261copTrimTextBoth :: (D.CContent c) => D.CopCalc c
262copTrimTextBoth = copTrimTextBy trimTextBoth
263
264copTrimTextBy :: (D.CContent c) => O.Bin String -> D.CopCalc c
265copTrimTextBy f arg =
266    do (trim, text) <- D.getRightArg2 arg
267       case D.isText trim && D.isText text of
268         True  -> D.putText $ f (D.gText trim) (D.gText text)
269         False -> typeUnmatch arg
270
271trimTextBegin :: (Eq a) => O.Bin [a]
272trimTextBegin s = dropWhile (`elem` s)
273
274trimTextEnd :: (Eq a) => O.Bin [a]
275trimTextEnd s = reverse . trimTextBegin s . reverse
276
277trimTextBoth :: (Eq a) => O.Bin [a]
278trimTextBoth s = trimTextEnd s . trimTextBegin s
279
280
281-- ----------------------  divide-text
282
283type Divider a = (a -> Bool) -> [a] -> [[a]]
284
285copDivideTextBy :: (D.CContent c) => Divider Char -> D.CopCalc c
286copDivideTextBy f arg =
287    do (divide, text) <- D.getRightArg2 arg
288       case D.isText divide && D.isText text of
289         True  -> D.putList $ D.pText <$> f (`elem` D.gText divide) (D.gText text)
290         False -> typeUnmatch arg
291
292-- | Divide list about beginning of list.
293--   This function returns two-element list: [match, right].
294--
295--   >>> divideBegin (== '1') "11-22-33-44-55"
296--   ["11","-22-33-44-55"]
297--
298--   >>> divideBegin (== '-') "11-22-33-44-55"
299--   ["","11-22-33-44-55"]
300
301divideBegin :: Divider a
302divideBegin p x =
303    let (match, right) = span p x
304    in [match, right]
305
306-- | Divide list at matching first.
307--   This function returns three-element list: [left, match, right].
308--
309--   >>> divideFirst (== '-') "11-22-33-44-55"
310--   ["11","-","22-33-44-55"]
311--
312--   >>> divideFirst (== '-') "-"
313--   ["","-",""]
314--
315--   >>> divideFirst (== '-') ""
316--   ["","",""]
317
318divideFirst :: Divider a
319divideFirst p x =
320    let (left, y)      = break p x
321        (match, right) = span  p y
322    in [left, match, right]
323
324-- | Divide list at matching last.
325--   This function returns three-element list: [left, match, right].
326--
327--   >>> divideLast (== '-') "11-22-33-44-55"
328--   ["11-22-33-44","-","55"]
329
330divideLast :: Divider a
331divideLast p x = reverse $ reverse <$> (divideFirst p $ reverse x)
332
333-- | Divide list about end of list.
334--   This function returns two-element list: [left, match].
335--
336--   >>> divideEnd (== '5') "11-22-33-44-55"
337--   ["11-22-33-44-","55"]
338
339divideEnd :: Divider a
340divideEnd p x = reverse $ reverse <$> (divideBegin p $ reverse x)
341
342-- | Divide list at all matching positions.
343--   This function returns odd-element list:
344--   [left, match, mid, match, ..., match, right].
345--   Matching sublists are in odd position.
346--
347--   >>> divideAll (== '-') "11-22-33-44-55"
348--   ["11","-","22","-","33","-","44","-","55"]
349--
350--   >>> divideAll (== '-') "-"
351--   ["","-",""]
352--
353--   >>> divideAll (== '-') ""
354--   [""]
355
356divideAll :: Divider a
357divideAll p x =
358    case divideFirst p x of
359      [left, [], []]       -> [left]
360      [left, match, []]    -> [left, match, []]
361      [left, match, right] -> left : match : divideAll p right
362      _                    -> error "unexpected value from divideFirst"
363
364
365-- ----------------------  general-symbol?
366
367copGeneralSymbol :: forall c. (D.CContent c) => D.CopCalc c
368copGeneralSymbol = copTestSymbol S.isGeneralSymbol
369
370copPlainSymbol :: forall c. (D.CContent c) => D.CopCalc c
371copPlainSymbol = copTestSymbol S.isPlainSymbol
372
373copNumericSymbol :: forall c. (D.CContent c) => D.CopCalc c
374copNumericSymbol = copTestSymbol S.isNumericSymbol
375
376copShortSymbol :: forall c. (D.CContent c) => D.CopCalc c
377copShortSymbol = copTestSymbol S.isShortSymbol
378
379copTestSymbol :: forall c. (D.CContent c) => (S.Symbol -> Bool) -> D.CopCalc c
380copTestSymbol test arg =
381    do c <- D.getRightArg1 arg
382       D.putBool $ case extractText c of
383                     Nothing  -> False
384                     Just s   -> case S.nextSymbol s of
385                                   ("", sym) -> test sym
386                                   _         -> False
387
388extractText :: (D.CContent c) => c -> Maybe String
389extractText c
390    | D.isCode c  = Just $ D.gCode c
391    | D.isText c  = Just $ D.gText c
392    | D.isTerm c  = Just $ D.gTerm c
393    | otherwise   = Nothing
394
395
396-- ----------------------  suffix & unsuffix
397
398-- | __suffix LIST__ adds unique suffixes to text elements of /LIST/.
399copSuffix :: (D.CText c, D.CList c) => D.CopCalc c
400copSuffix = op where
401    op [Right ls] | D.isList ls && (all D.isText $ D.gList ls)
402           = D.putList (D.pText <$> B.uniqueNames '-' (D.gText <$> D.gList ls))
403    op [c] = c
404    op xs  = typeUnmatch xs
405
406-- | __unsuffix C__ remove integer suffixes from /C/.
407copUnsuffix :: forall c. (D.CContent c) => D.CopCalc c
408copUnsuffix = op where
409    op [Right c] = Right $ unsuf c
410    op [c]       = c
411    op xs        = typeUnmatch xs
412
413    unsuf c | D.isText c  = D.pText $ B.unsuffix Ch.isDigit '-' $ D.gText c
414            | D.isList c  = D.pList (unsuf <$> D.gList c)
415            | D.isSet  c  = D.pSet  (unsuf <$> D.gSet c)
416            | otherwise   = c
417
